text: Kenneth "Ken" Snow (June 23, 1969 â€“ June 21, 2020) was an American soccer forward. He was a two-time winner of the Hermann Trophy. He had an eight-year professional career playing indoor soccer in the United States. He played for the men's national team in 1988. From 1991 to 1995, he played for the Chicago Power. Snow was born in Arlington Heights, Illinois. Snow died on June 21, 2020 from COVID-19 in Port Huron, Michigan at the age of 50.GOODBYE, KEN: Snow, former Indiana standout, 2-time Hermann Trophy winner, passes away ==References== Category:1969 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Michigan Category:American soccer players Category:Sportspeople from Illinois Category:People from Arlington Heights, Illinois
title: Ken Snow
